stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream building Course 13 (an ice-castle stage): blocking out platform ideas, then wrestling with code, materials, and particles to create a hexagonal ice platform that cracks on the first jump and shatters on the second. He lists other gimmicks he wants in the level and accidentally fixes an old engine bug while debugging. Personal news (the upcoming birth of his daughter) shapes release-schedule talk.

development_findings.summary: Current focus is Course 13; Kaze is ‘grey-boxing’ the stage and modelling all its unique platforms before designing final platforming.
development_findings.quote: So what I did is I moved the frame in OBS and it instantly crashed… Anyway, today our goal is to kind of greybox the level… Basically, make the platforming good.

development_findings.summary: Desired Course 13 gimmicks: ice waves that move forward, cracking ice tiles, interior wind gusts, spinning ice shards, an appearing path (Galaxy light-bulb style), and large swinging axes.
development_findings.quote: Ice waves that move forward… an ice platform that cracks on the first jump and breaks on the second… wind gusts… a spinning ice shard… ice path that appears as you get closer… big swinging axes.

development_findings.summary: Hack is ‘slightly over 80 % done’; Course 13 itself is roughly 3 / 5 complete (office and boss areas still missing).
development_findings.quote: The hack is just slightly over 80 % done I would say.

development_findings.summary: Main technical challenge this stream: building an N64-friendly shader/material + particle system so the ice hexagon shows cracks, dissolves, and throws triangles/mist when it breaks.
development_findings.quote: I want to make like a decent looking ice hexagon that you can stand on and then the second time it crashes.

development_findings.summary: Accidentally fixed a long-standing RAM-pointer mis-alignment bug while writing a new GEO function for the platform.
development_findings.quote: No way— that fixed the bug! What the fuck.

development_findings.summary: A prior bug fix disabled the well-known triple-jump-kick exploit; Kaze is undecided whether to re-enable the move or remove kicks altogether.
development_findings.quote: I could probably program it back in… I'm 50-50 on whether I want it in the game.

development_findings.summary: Planning to make cracked platforms respawn after a delay so no route becomes impossible.
Considering Biobak’s ‘appearing path’ for the Snowman Hideout but needs to retrofit castle geometry first.
development_findings.quote: Biobak's appearing path thing, yes. I definitely want that in here.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina are expecting a daughter in about two months; this may delay events like F3 or release videos.
context_findings.quote: We're going to have a kid in like two months… I don't know if I can do an F3 this year.

context_findings.summary: He questions his public identity (YouTuber vs game developer) and jokes about being an ‘influencer.’
context_findings.quote: This is actually what my life has been this whole time? I've just been a YouTuber, not a game developer.

context_findings.summary: Debugging philosophy: postpone minor bugs because they sometimes resolve accidentally during other work.
context_findings.quote: Sometimes bugs just randomly get fixed like that.

context_findings.summary: General worldview: distrust of advertising—he refuses products that pay for ads.
context_findings.quote: When I see an ad I actively decide not to buy the product anymore.

context_findings.summary: Personal humor and naming: jokes about calling the baby ‘Reina’ as an evil rival to Zeina (à la Wario/Waluigi).
Low interest in tourism; prefers events like Comic-Con over visiting cities.

biobak.summary: Provided texture files, a Blender test scene, and shader advice for the cracking-ice platform.
biobak.quote: Let me get the textures from Biobak's file… Biobak, is this what you were thinking?

biobak.summary: Earlier designed the ‘appearing path’ mechanic that Kaze wants to include in Course 13.

zeina.summary: Working on a ‘special, documentary-style’ release video for the slide level; Kaze is waiting on her plan before finalising the video.
zeina.quote: Eiza had like a special plan for the video… I'm waiting for that to be settled first.

zeina.summary: Appears in chat, subs to the channel, and is part of the on-stream banter, but no direct dev tasks mentioned this session.

key_stories.title: Building the Cracking Ice Platform
key_stories.summary: Kaze spends hours prototyping a hexagonal ice tile that survives one jump and shatters on the next. He iterates through shader math, texture formats, and particle effects with chat feedback and Biobak’s sample files.
key_stories.challenge: Make a visually convincing, CPU-friendly cracking animation on N64 hardware.
key_stories.process: Experimented with primitive-color alpha blending, threshold functions, and custom particle spawns; fixed crashes and wrong pointers; tweaked texture contrast and timing.
key_stories.outcome: A three-stage platform (safe, cracked, gone) with mist and triangle shards—Kaze still ‘not happy’ but will refine later.
key_stories.key_quote: At this point I think we just have to take it as it is—maybe I'll randomly have inspiration later.

key_stories.title: The Bug That Fixed Itself
key_stories.summary: While coding the platform, Kaze accidentally corrected a long-standing memory-pointer bug that broke music and animations after loading area 2.
key_stories.challenge: Mysterious ROM-pointer mis-alignment causing crashes and lost audio.
key_stories.process: Noticed crashes, realised he was reading the wrong register (S8) instead of the timer, corrected it, and found the old issue gone.
key_stories.outcome: Unexpectedly stabilised the engine; reinforces Kaze’s laissez-faire bug-fix philosophy.

key_stories.title: Fatherhood vs Development Schedule
key_stories.summary: Kaze publicly shares that he and Zeina expect a daughter, affecting event attendance and release timing.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing imminent parenthood with ROM-hack milestones and community events like F3.
key_stories.process: Announced pregnancy on stream, jokes about baby names, decides he ‘probably can’t’ do F3, and will wait for Zeina’s video plan before releasing content.
key_stories.outcome: Team and fans aware of adjusted timelines; adds personal dimension to project narrative.
key_stories.key_quote: I don't know if I can do an F3 this year, because I'm going to have a child releasing in a bit.
